info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 1 at 1:54AM PDT until July 1 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN NEVADA AND NORTHWESTERN ARIZONA FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY AS WELL AS AREAS OF DRY THUNDERSTORMS...
The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 8 PM MST this evening.
* AFFECTED AREA...In AZZ102...Fire weather zone 102.
* TIMING...11 am this morning through 8 pm this evening MST.
* HUMIDITY...10 TO 15 percent.
* THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated to scattered dry thunderstorms are expected to develop through the afternoon hours and move westward while continuing into the evening hours.
* OUTFLOW WINDS...Strong outflow wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph are possible.
* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
